summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from October to November 2019 between the FBI National Press Office and BBC journalist Laura Burns regarding the status of the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The journalist inquires about potential indictments, arrest warrants, cooperation with British authorities, and the analysis of images/videos from Epstein's homes, specifically asking about Prince Andrew's presence. The FBI consistently responds with 'no comment' or minimal statements that the investigation is ongoing.

persons.name: Laura Burns
persons.context: BBC journalist repeatedly contacting the FBI National Press Office for updates on the Epstein investigation for a documentary, asking specific questions about arrest warrants, international cooperation, and evidence.

persons.name: Amy
persons.context: An FBI National Press Office staff member who is forwarded the journalist's inquiry and suggests responding with 'no comment'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the FBI investigation that is the subject of the journalist's inquiries.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Named in the journalist's questions to the FBI, specifically asking if British authorities have been contacted regarding him and if he is present in images/videos recovered from Epstein's homes.

connections.description: Journalist (Burns) is seeking information from the FBI Press Office (where Amy works) regarding the Epstein investigation.
The journalist's questions imply a known association, asking the FBI to confirm if Prince Andrew is present in images/videos recovered from Epstein's homes.

events.title: FBI 'No Comment' Response
events.description: The FBI National Press Office responds to Laura Burns's initial inquiry with 'no comment'.

events.title: Journalist Requests Background Briefing
events.description: Laura Burns follows up, asking if the FBI could provide a confidential background briefing on the Epstein investigation by December.

events.title: BBC Query on Upcoming Indictments
events.description: Internal FBI email forwarding a BBC query about reports that the FBI is preparing to issue arrest warrants for co-conspirators in the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduled Documentary Broadcast
events.description: The documentary Laura Burns is producing is scheduled to broadcast in the UK.

keyFacts: In November 2019, the BBC was inquiring about reports that the FBI was preparing to issue arrest warrants for co-conspirators in the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The FBI consistently declined to comment on the ongoing investigation, including questions about international cooperation and specific evidence.
A BBC journalist specifically asked the FBI to confirm if they had recovered and were analyzing a library of images/videos from Epstein's homes, and if Prince Andrew was present in those files.
The correspondence shows media pressure and public interest in the Epstein investigation in late 2019, following Epstein's death in August of that year.
The journalist referenced an embargo, indicating planned future reporting on the investigation's findings.
